result.execSummary:
The defendant Julian M Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Concurrent with: Case 13CF5487
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program. Defendant is appropriate for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
If revoked, court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.

miscConds.notes: No violent contact with the victim.
Attend parenting class. Court will allow the parenting class to be completed with the victim present.

Obtain HSED or GED. Obtain further educational or vocational training. Maintain full time schooling and part time employment (16 hours) OR maintain full time employment while taking at least one educational class.
Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Complete AODA assessment. If not completed by release, then to be completed while on probation.

timeConds.notes: To be used at the discretion of the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Julian M Lopez in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Julian M Lopez in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution to this matter. 

As to COUNT 2- On motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read in for purposes of sentencing. 

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law. Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Case adjourned to Branch 25. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Julian M Lopez in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Julian M Lopez in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Defense counsel was unable to meet with the defendant due to a medical emergency and requests an adjournment. State does not object. Court grants defense request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Julian M Lopez in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty on both counts.  State orally amends the Information to reflect the correct address of the Criminal Justice Facility.  
State moves for joinder.  Defense objects without argument.  Court grants the State's motion to join with case 13cf5487, for trial.  
Defendant's revocation hearing is scheduled on 3-6-14; defendant is expected to waive and may need to be produced from the State prison system for the next court date.  
Defense request for a plea date, granted.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Julian M Lopez in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan.  Defendant Julian M Lopez in custody.  Jennifer Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Suszek-Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office Investigator.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CS dob 8/18/97 or her family, residence, workplace or school

Defendant Julian M Lopez in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan who appears as a friend of the Court.  Defendant Julian M Lopez in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
